  • Field Details

    • STANDARD_EOL

      public static final Pattern STANDARD_EOL
      Matches a standard end-of-line indicator, identical to Common.lexh's {EOL}.

    • APOS_NO_BSESC

      public static final Pattern APOS_NO_BSESC
      Matches an apostrophe not following a backslash escape or following an even number¹ of backslash escapes.

      ¹See RegexUtils.getNotFollowingEscapePattern() for a caveat about the backslash assertion.

    • END_C_COMMENT

      public static final Pattern END_C_COMMENT
      Matches the close of a C comment.

  • Method Details

    • isPossiblyJavaClass

      public static boolean isPossiblyJavaClass(String s)
      Returns true if the string is possibly a Java class name, and only matching a subset of possible class names to prevent false positives.

      • class must be qualified with a package name
      • package name must contain only letters and start lower case
      • class name must be in CamelCase and start upper case
      Parameters:
      s - the string to be checked
      Returns:
      true if string could be a java class name

    • getReadableTime

      public static String getReadableTime(long timeMs)
      Convert value in milliseconds to readable time.
      Parameters:
      timeMs - delta in milliseconds
      Returns:
      human readable string

    • nthIndexOf

      public static int nthIndexOf(String str, String substr, int n)
      Finds n-th index of a given substring in a string.
      Parameters:
      str - an original string
      substr - a substring to match
      n - n-th occurrence
      Returns:
      the index of the first character of the substring in the original string where the substring occurred n-th times in the string. If the n-th candidate does not exist, -1 is returned.

    • countURIEndingPushback

      public static int countURIEndingPushback(String value)
      Count the number of ending pushback characters from a matched URI.

      jflex does not support negative lookbehind, so modifying a URI matcher to backtrack on ending characters that are otherwise normally valid (e.g. '.') is difficult. Instead, this method allows counting and pushing back.

      Parameters:
      value - the URI to test
      Returns:
      the number of characters greater than or equal to zero which could be pushed back.

    • patindexOf

      public static int patindexOf(String value, Pattern pattern)
      Determines if the specified pattern matches in the specified value.
      Parameters:
      value - the string to inspect
      pattern - the pattern to match
      Returns:
      the index of the first occurrence of the specified pattern, or -1 if there is no such occurrence

    • startsWithFpathChar

      public static boolean startsWithFpathChar(String value)
      Determines if the value starts with a character in CommonPath.lexh's {FPath}.
      Parameters:
      value - the input to test
      Returns:
      true if value matches at its start

    • countPushback

      public static int countPushback(String capture, Pattern pat)
      Determines if the specified pattern, pat, matches the specified capture, and computes an eligible pushback.
      Parameters:
      capture - a defined input
      pat - a pattern, or null to skip computation
      Returns:
      a positive value if pat matches in capture at or after the second character to indicate the number of characters to pushback including the first-matched character; otherwise 0 to indicate no match or a match at the 0-th character. (The 0-th chracter is ineligible for fear of looping non-stop upon pushing back the entire yytext().)

    • whitespaceOrControlLength

      public static int whitespaceOrControlLength(String str, int off, boolean shouldMatch)
      Determine the length of the next whitespace- or ISO control character-related sequence within a string.
      Parameters:
      str - a defined instance
      off - the starting offset within str
      shouldMatch - a value indicating whether to match all contiguous whitespace or ISO control characters (true) or all contiguous non-whitespace and non-control characters (false) starting at off
      Returns:
      a length greater than or equal to zero
